Absolutely firrrrreeee meal. The Fashsa (lamb) is a flavor bomb. Beware itâ€™s hot inside so wear layers, otherwise 10/10 food.

Itâ€™s a nice little restaurant with a decent amount of tables and chairs so a spot to sit and eat is commonly found. Their rotisserie chicken is juicy because the size of the chicken they use, some places be using 30lb chicken to â€œsellâ€ the most meat but here they use maybe 10-15lb chickens making them more tender and juicy ğŸ¤¤. Their pricing is fair compared to other Yemeni/middle eastern restaurants. This is my go to Yemeni cuisine when Iâ€™m in the Bronx,
Check the price before ordering
love it
Great food and service but the price is very high.

I used to go this place for couple of years but now itâ€™s seems that they are much busy and popular no more good and fresh food and as well as good service here :(
Also I noticed they always charge you extra bill than what you have been servedâ€¦ be careful to check your bill.
I noticed they charge us 2-3 times extra $10-15 extra and when I tried to check food price on the menu the employee says the menu is not updated and the real prices are higher than the menu shows which does not make sense, I mean why would you have out dated menu while you are a 5 star restaurant and very busyâ€¦ I believe this is HARAM for a Muslim business to charge extra bill and then make up stories and not admit the mistake and return the money back, I am very disappointed from such halal place to cheat on you for few extra doller:(

Best halal grill in town. I go here my my wife and kids and you can eat like a king for under 60 dollars.

I was really disappointed with the food quality here. The lamb tasted old and I felt nauseous after eating it. Considering I paid around $30, I expected a lot more. Unfortunately, the food was subpar and I won't be returning.
The food is delicious and tastes great. Their service is excellent.
Nice food ğŸ‘ğŸ»â€¦
Beautiful restaurant, delicious food and great customer service.
Food is good
I often come to have my Moroccan couscous, it's like eating at home with your family, it's definitely the best couscous you can eat in New York
Grill was 10 /10

Food was from a day before
Has no taste
And smells bad
I don't recommend this restaurant at all
It is one of the best arabs restaurants, a good food, a good service, a good people
One of the best arab Yemeni foods
I eat a very delicious food restaurant, a wonderful service, grandfather and thank you

I wish I never had came here the shawarma guy was to busy watching the soccer game when i told him I needed 3 shawarma well done his face turned up side down and remind you im paying $21 and he ended up putting ketchup and mayo in my shawarma and the chicken is not even cooked I threw the whole food a way Ù„Ù„Ø§Ø¶Ø­Ø§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ù„ ØªØ§ÙƒØ¯Ùˆ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù…Ù„ØªÙƒÙ… Ø¬ÙŠØ¯Ù‡ Ù„Ù„Ø¹Ù…Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ ÙŠØ¬ÙŠ ÙŠØ®Ø±Ø¨ Ø§ÙƒÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø²Ø¨ÙˆÙ† Ù„Ø§Ù†Ù‡Ùˆ Ø¶Ø§Ø¨Ø­ Ø§Ùˆ Ù…Ø´ØºÙˆÙ„ ÙÙˆÙ‚ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…Ø¨Ø§Ø±Ù‡ Ù†Ø§ ÙŠØµÙ„Ø­ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù† Ø±Ù…ÙŠØª ÙƒÙ„ Ø§ÙƒÙ„ÙƒÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø²Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø³Ø¨Ø¨ Ø¹Ù†Ø§Ø¯ ØµØ§Ø­Ø¨ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙˆØ§Ø±Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙˆÙ†ÙˆÙ‡Ø§Ù…Ù„Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø²Ø¨ÙˆÙ† Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¯ÙØ¹ Ø§Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ø¯ÙØ¹ ÙÙ„ÙˆØ³ Ø§Ø±ÙŠØ¯ Ø§ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ø«Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø³ Ø³Ù†Ø¯ÙˆÙŠØ´ ÙƒØªØ´Ø¨ Ø®Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù„ÙƒÙ… Ø§Ø®Ø± Ù…Ø±Ù‡ Ø§ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ù† Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ù„
The restaurant is situated in a high-traffic area. While the food quality was acceptable, the service was significantly deficient, particularly for takeout.
Food is fresh and delicious.
It's a great place and the food tastes different they are very friendly the restaurant is very simple but the food is divine it's amazing I travel an hour to get there it's worth it
They make delicious food and reasonable prices.
It is an amazing place
Nice place and good food and family
Very nasty place, food donâ€™t taste good other Yemeni restaurants are way much better in the same area

Probably the worst food I have tried in this area. It was hard to tell which was worse, was it the food or the service! For the price it is, you guys can do better. At least provide plates and spoons to the customers. Donâ€™t waste your time and money here!

I was on a day trip to explore little yemen and this spot definitely delivered. It had all the things I expect from a local Yemeni spot. The service is very candid and easy going. The food was on point with all the right fixings. I got a roasted chicken with rice and a plate of okra. Highly recommended if you want a taste of yemen or youre missing home.

This is one of my favorite spots to eat in NYC. The food is excellent and everyone there is so nice and welcoming. Unfortunately, they have problems with hygiene.

1. Some of the workers there would be touching their mouths, playing with their masks, and then serving you the food.

2. One of the employees was wearing very dirty clothes with food and oil stuck on the shirt.

3. The tea machine that serves complimentary tea for customers is a great idea, but again, there is mold smell coming out from the tea. They should clean the machine before serving complimentary tea for customers.

4. They place the uncooked chicken on the floor? I mean, COME ON. You do not ever do that. (Refer to the attached picture)

This makes me worry even more about how clean the kitchen is from inside.

I will remove this review once the manager/owner responds back to my review and assures us in the response that they will take strict measurements when it comes to hygiene because I don't want to affect their business.

I love this place, but I get disappointed with the hygiene.
So good Yemeni food Iâ€™d say best on the block. Busy atmosphere, not the greatest choice  for a fine dining experience but foods great.

Staff is attentive, and the restaurant is clean. Most importantly, food is great except the
Grill House Specialty Platter, which had a lot of salt. Roasted lamb was on point.

Good chicken kabab. Amazing hummus and bread. 4 stars because the service was so slow on the day we went, we were not offered napkins or water till we asked, and perhaps this is the trend in Yemeni restaurants that I'm not aware of, but other patrons will leave all their bones and trash on the table itself rather than on plates. I'd do takeout next time.

I am a loyal and accustomed customer to Yemen cafe on Atlantic however after many visits to the bronx I happen to stop and try this place. Little did I know, this place is a gem. Very generous portion, delicious, still inexpensive(16 for aâ€¦
Wonderful Yemeni restaurant.  The soup and saltah is so good.  The lamb is so tender and the pilaf is flavorful!  5 stars hands down!

Amazing food. It was the first meal I had during my trip to nyc, and it was amazing. The food here as amazing as restaurant back home. We had grilled chicken and fahsa both were amazing. Also, they give you salad and marg and tea as a complementary serve.
Mi primera vez y no me arrepiento. Todo estuvo riquisimo. Y muy buen precio.
Hospitality is great and the food is awesome. I also love the great portraits of Yemen.

The staff are nice,  Service is alright could do better tho, some foods are pretty good, some are a bit bland for example I ordered some buram lamb with rice and fatteh. the lamb was very juicy and delicious, but the fatteh I got was bland and very dry.
Before It was soft rice and meat but now rice is too hard. And it doesn't taste good anymore. Another thing is customer service is too bad.

The fahsa is to die for... absolutely just AMAZING!!! I give the raring just for that. Whenever we go there as a group, my friends know that it is the only thing I wish to order (I eat other stuff too lol). And staff and the main host I've seen there are all very friendly. The food is amazing and so is their service.
Great food maybe the best !!  but be ready to wait for longer times ! Anyone would jump and take your turn just let it go and enjoy the food

This is my first time being there I loved to try new cuisine thatâ€™s why I search for a Yemeni restaurant and find out this place is very popular. The main problem I faced that no one can speak English so we had a hard time to order ourâ€¦

The best food the best service the best place to visit

Amazing Arabic food, specifically from Yemen.

Lamb was amazing ğŸ‘. Ø´ÙƒØ±Ø§

Always crowded,  because it's the best and most authentic taste of the Yemeni food!.
I highly recommend them if you are committed to eat some great food.

Food was ok...lamb meat was very dry. The young man working behind the counter was slow & acted as if he didn't want to be at work.He Was slow getting off his cell phone as he walked over to see what I wanted then proceeded to act like he didn't want to be there.

DONâ€™T GET FOOLED BY THE PICS NOR BY THE REVIEW!! STAY AWAY!!!
this was one of the worst experience I ever had since years.
I really donâ€™t know where to start and what to say .
I will be accurate and subjective.

Sanitary : food spells all over the place, on table and floors, never cleaned properly , you canâ€™t even know where to step . Everything very sticky. The so-called salad bar left open and exposed to everyone . The soup pot is dirty and soup spelled all around. The butcher came from inside with his white coat covered by blood to have a break in the dinning area which was very disgusting .

Food quality : Rotisserie chicken was extremely dry and hard like a cardboard, My teeth got hurt from chewing for the rest of the day . It looks like it has been cooked hours ago and lift under the grill( god knows for how long ) . The 1/2 chicken was extremely small and was actually a half chick , which I paid $18 for with rice. Rice was undercooked and chewy.

Prices : very expensive compared to the portion and quality . They raise the prices and reduce the portions with no quality what so ever. Average meal in mid 20â€™s .

I really feel hurt after that experience , not only because what I have seen , but because from my experience in the Yamani kitchen, it is one of the tastiest food  in the world and this reflects a very bad picture about if .
I hope this review will guide you in your trip .

Love the customer service here! Came here in the morning around 12-3:am and I went in and sat and waited for a waitress I was approached by a little sweet 14 year old boy who proceeded to give me some  soup and salad , (witch tasted great)â€¦
Good food , friendly staff

food is ok but their portion is too little. u need to pay for two meals to get full which is ridiculous. I asked him why the portion are too little he recommended ordering two dishes $22 each.. so never go back again unless u want to eatâ€¦

Be careful here. I went there today, and these people tried to rip me off. Firstly I ordered something else and received something else not knowing the food so I just ate it. Then they tried to charge me for the mistaken order. I feel like I got scammed.  Plus the food is pretty bad, would not recommend. SCAMMERS.

I ordered half chicken and rice with a shawarma sandwich. The food was good , but lacked spices and was slightly bland. Soup was fantastic, very meaty and rich with fat. Their bread is also good. 8/10
The best breakfast in USA. We had shakshokah, fool, liver and ma3soob. The best food but I think they could work more on thedine-in services.
